problems.title: Validate Red-Black Tree Properties
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given a binary tree in level-order form where each node is represented as value:color. Color is either R (Red) or B (Black). -1 represents a NULL child.

Your task is to check whether this binary tree satisfies ALL Red-Black Tree (RBT) properties:

1. Every node is either RED or BLACK.
2. The root must be BLACK.
3. No RED node can have a RED parent (no consecutive RED nodes).
4. All NULL children are considered BLACK.
5. Every path from the root to any NULL leaf must contain the same number of BLACK nodes (Black-Height property).

If all properties are satisfied, print YES. Otherwise, print NO.

Input Format
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N entries: value:color or -1.

Output Format
Print YES or NO.

Example
Input:
7
10:B 5:R 15:R -1 -1 -1 -1

Output:
NO

Explanation:
Both children of root are RED → violates rule 3.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
7
10:B 5:B 15:B -1 -1 -1 -1

Sample Output 1
YES

Sample Input 2
7
10:B 5:R 15:R -1 -1 -1 -1

Sample Output 2
NO
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 1000
Values are integers
Color must be R or B
hintsList: Check if root is Black and no Red parent-child exists.
Calculate black-height for every path and ensure they are equal.
